recipes.title: Chicken Thukpa
steps: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add sliced onions and sauté until translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies. Sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add turmeric, cumin, and coriander powder. Stir well.
Add chicken slices and cook until they turn white, about 5-6 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften, about 3-4 minutes.
Pour in the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add noodles and cook according to package instructions (usually 5-7 minutes).
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve hot with lime wedges on the side.
recipes.description: A comforting Nepali noodle soup with tender chicken, aromatic spices, and fresh herbs. Perfect for a quick and satisfying meal.

recipes.title: Chicken Keema Noodles
steps: Heat oil in a large pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Cook for 1 minute.
Add ground chicken and break it up with a spoon. Cook until browned, about 5-6 minutes.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down, about 4-5 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Add cooked noodles to the chicken mixture. Toss everything together.
Season with salt. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with lime wedges.
recipes.description: Spicy and flavorful Nepali-style chicken keema noodles. A quick stir-fry that's packed with aromatic spices and tender ground chicken.

recipes.title: Avocado Toast with Egg
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Fresh chives or microgreens for garnish
steps: Toast the bread slices until golden and crispy.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl.
Mash the avocado with a fork. Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Crack the eggs into the pan and cook to your preference (sunny-side up or over-easy).
Spread the mashed avocado evenly on the toasted bread.
Place the cooked egg on top of the avocado toast.
Season with additional salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if desired.
Garnish with fresh chives or microgreens and serve immediately.
recipes.description: A simple yet delicious breakfast classic. Creamy avocado paired with a perfectly cooked egg on crispy toast.

recipes.title: Homemade Chilli Oil
steps: In a heatproof bowl, combine red chili flakes, Sichuan peppercorns, salt, and sesame seeds.
Heat the oil in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add garlic, ginger, star anise, and cinnamon stick.
Cook gently for 5-7 minutes until the garlic and ginger are golden but not burnt.
Remove the whole spices (star anise, cinnamon) from the oil.
Carefully pour the hot oil over the chili flake mixture. It should sizzle and bubble.
Stir well and let it cool completely.
Transfer to a clean jar and store in the refrigerator. It will keep for several weeks.
Use as a condiment for noodles, dumplings, rice, or any dish that needs a spicy kick.
recipes.description: A versatile and aromatic chili oil that adds heat and flavor to any dish. Easy to make and stores well.

recipes.title: Palpali Chukauni
steps: Boil potatoes until tender. Let them cool, then cube them.
Heat mustard oil in a small pan. Add fenugreek seeds and let them splutter.
Add turmeric and red chili powder. Remove from heat immediately.
In a mixing bowl, combine cubed potatoes, chopped onion, and green chilies.
Add the spiced oil mixture and mix well.
Add thick yogurt and mix gently until everything is well combined.
Season with salt and add lime juice to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve chilled or at room temperature.
This dish pairs perfectly with rice, roti, or as a side with any Nepali meal.
recipes.description: A tangy and refreshing Nepali potato salad from the Palpa region. Cool yogurt, spicy chilies, and aromatic fenugreek create a perfect balance.
